channel.title: Classs that are Weak
channel.description:
Hi I am new to ToL , I enjoy it but I kind of feel that when I get a few certain classes I really cant contribute much to the game .
The two that I most feel this with are Noble and Court Wizard
Nobles ability to hear whispers seldom bring out anything that's useful , usually " I am your merc " "yay" or some investigator asking someone to back up there reasons for a "read" but the investigator will reveal this anyway if he is not happy .
The noble cry is weak as their is no way to know after turn 1 if the noble is converted or not .
The few games I have had as a noble I have kind of floundered around waiting for a chance to go king .
Court Wizard as well seems to be a bit of a bumble about .
The magic barrier in the first few turns unless you have some definite leads usually just leads to people being misidentified as some sort of scum because you made them immune to investigator . The investigator then declares oh guys X is immune to occupy , I know cos I am sherrif . Then the CW if he is paying attention goes , oh wait that was me and now nothing is known accept who the investigator and court wizard are .
Am I missing things here ?

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Sketch:

lol like this scenario happens in every single game…

I have been noble maybe 10 times, and 4 times I listened to a mass whisper claim

Sketch:

another unlikely circumstance, but a neat trick if this actually works how I think it does. you are saying if you target the Possessor as soon as he jumps, his new body won’t be able to vote? I’d be surprised if it’s coded that way.

I have done it before, same reason why poss needs to heal when jumping: bleed would carry over

Read full topic

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

Noble is one of the best classes.

-prince is revived-

-maid spy prince-

-prince says: everyone whisper me roles-

suddenly, you know everyone’s claims!

lol like this scenario happens in every single game…

RopeStringFace:

In addition, order can be used to find the poss. say you used it on them the same night they body jumped; whoever can’t vote the following day is possessor!

another unlikely circumstance, but a neat trick if this actually works how I think it does. you are saying if you target the Possessor as soon as he jumps, his new body won’t be able to vote? I’d be surprised if it’s coded that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
I meant to say under powered.

Also, the sheriff situation is VERY common.

Hippolytus:

CW is weaker than basically every other BD class atm

No, CW is not.

Hippolytus:

His abilities are far more situational than other classes and even when they work another class is often preferable.

the situation in which blocking conversion comes in handy IS EVERY OTHER NIGHT.

Read full topic

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

CW is not over powered.

I know.

RopeStringFace:

IF sheriff has been revealed, you can prevent them from being converted, occupied, and mind warped. How is that UP?

IF. And even then, I’d rather have an observer on the Sheriff to catch the bad guys than just a CW. CW is weaker than basically every other BD class atm. His abilities are far more situational than other classes and even when they work another class is often preferable.

Read full topic

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
CW is not over powered.

IF sheriff has been revealed, you can prevent them from being converted, occupied, and mind warped. How is that UP?

I do think noble needs another ability, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
I agree Noble and Court Wizard are both pretty shit atm. They were both majorly reworked in the last few months so hopefully the Devs are still looking into them.

Read full topic

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Noble is one of the best classes.

-prince is revived-
-maid spy prince-
-prince says: everyone whisper me roles-
suddenly, you know everyone’s claims!

In addition, order can be used to find the poss. say you used it on them the same night they body jumped; whoever can’t vote the following day is possessor!

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: Methnor
item.description:
newarkinvaders:

The magic barrier in the first few turns unless you have some definite leads usually just leads to people being misidentified as some sort of scum because you made them immune to investigator .

The investigator then declares oh guys X is immune to occupy , I know cos I am sherrif . Then the CW if he is paying attention goes , oh wait that was me and now nothing is known accept who the investigator and court wizard are .

Uh, what? CW doesn’t make people immune to investigations, and also Sheriff doesn’t occupy.

Read full topic

item.title: Classs that are Weak
item.dc:creator: newarkinvaders
item.description:
Hi I am new to ToL , I enjoy it but I kind of feel that when I get a few certain classes I really cant contribute much to the game .

The two that I most feel this with are
Noble and Court Wizard

Nobles ability to hear whispers seldom bring out anything that’s useful , usually " I am your merc " “yay” or some investigator asking someone to back up there reasons for a “read” but the investigator will reveal this anyway if he is not happy .

The noble cry is weak as their is no way to know after turn 1 if the noble is converted or not .

Court Wizard as well seems to be a bit of a bumble about .

The investigator then declares oh guys X is immune to occupy , I know cos I am sherrif . Then the CW if he is paying attention goes , oh wait that was me and now nothing is known accept who the investigator and court wizard are .
